trans-unit.source: Allows a control to create e-mail messages from text files or strings.
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the name of the file that contains text for the body of the e-mail message.
The name of the file that contains the message body text.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets a comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to send a copy (CC) of the message to.
The CC property contains a list of additional recipients of the e-mail message.

If the CC property contains an improperly formed e-mail address, the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception and the e-mail message is not sent.
A comma-separated list of e-mail addresses to send a copy (CC) of the message to.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Creates an e-mail message from a text file to send by means of SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol).
The CreateMailMessage method creates a new <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> object that can be sent using the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

The <xref:System.Web.Mail.MailMessage.BodyFormat%2A> property must be set to indicate whether the mail message should be formatted as plain text (<xref:System.Web.Mail.MailFormat?displayProperty=fullName>) or HTML (<xref:System.Web.Mail.MailFormat?displayProperty=fullName>).
The `recipients` parameter contains a comma-separated list of recipients of the e-mail message.

If the `recipients` parameter contains an improperly formatted Internet e-mail address, the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception and the e-mail message is not sent.
The `replacements` parameter is an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> instance that contains a list of strings to substitute.
Strings are replaced in the order in which they were added to the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> collection, and they can overwrite earlier replacements.
The `owner` parameter indicates which control is the parent of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> control.
It determines which directory to search for the text file specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.BodyFileName%2A> property.
A comma-separated list of message recipients.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> containing a list of strings and their replacement strings.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that owns this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref>.
The e-mail message from a text file.
replacements does not contain strings.
owner is .
Creates an e-mail message with replacements from a text file to send by means of SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.CreateMailMessage%2A> method creates a new <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> object that can be sent with the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The `recipients` parameter contains a comma-separated list of recipients of the e-mail message.

If the `recipients` parameter contains an improperly formatted Internet e-mail address, the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A> method throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception and the e-mail message is not sent.
The `replacements` parameter is an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> instance that contains a list of strings to substitute.
Strings are replaced in the order in which they were added to the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> collection, and they can overwrite earlier replacements.
The `body` parameter contains the text of the e-mail message.
The `owner` parameter indicates which control is the parent of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> control.
It determines which directory to search for the text file specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.BodyFileName%2A> property.
The comma-separated list of recipients.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> containing a list of strings and their replacement strings.
The text of the e-mail message.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that owns this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref>.
The e-mail message with replacements from a text file.
replacements does not contain strings.
owner is .

Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObject"></xref> instances, typically used to embed images in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref> object before sending an e-mail to a user.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObject> items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectsCollection> collection returned by the EmbeddedObjects property represent items to embed in an e-mail message.
These items can include image files such as company logos or other graphics.

An <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObjectsCollection"></xref> instances used to embed images in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition"></xref> object before sending an e-mail to a user.
Gets or sets the e-mail address of the message sender.
The From property contains the e-mail address of the sender of the e-mail message.

If the From property is left blank, or contains an improperly formed e-mail address, the <xref:System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception and the e-mail message is not sent.
The e-mail address of the message sender.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the body of the e-mail is HTML.
Use the IsBodyHtml property to specify whether the body of the e-mail message contains plain text or HTML markup.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the body of the e-mail is HTML; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the priority of the e-mail message.
The Priority property indicates the relative priority of the e-mail message.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailPriority"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailPriority"></xref>.
The selected value is not one of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.MailPriority"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the subject line of the e-mail message.
The Subject property is used as the subject line of the e-mail message.
It can be left empty.
The subject line of the e-mail message.
The default is <xref:System.String>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the server control is saving changes to its view state.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.

> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition.BodyFileName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.EmbeddedMailObject.Path%2A> properties are not saved in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the control is marked to save its state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState*> method.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the control state to be restored.
Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The server control's current view state.
Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MailDefinition> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
